wikipedia_page.main: Brigadier-General Henry Alexander Walker, CB,  CMG, DSO, H.P (20 October 1874 – 1 May 1953) was a British Army officer who served with the Royal Fusiliers regiment, and later with the King's African Rifles in the First World War.

response: * Captain Henry Alexander Walker, 1st Battalion KAR
*Major and Brevet Lieutenant-Colonel Henry Alexander Walker  Royal Fusiliers

Wadamago is also the site where a battalion led by Henry Alexander Walker performed mundane escort duties and fatigues for a year before returning to Nyasaland.http://hornwatch4rights.blogspot.co.uk/2014/04/history-of-somaliland-protectorate-from.htmlhttp://www.thegazette.co.uk/London/issue/28385/page/4262
*Henry Alexander Walker (1874–1953), British Army honorary brigadier general
